qas.question: In what form is 1/4 of zinc used in the US?
What kind of zinc compound is used in manufacturing rubber?
What protects the polymers in rubber from ultraviolet radiation?
Why is zinc oxide useful in photocopying products?
What kind of process is the zinc zinc-oxide cycle?
What form is 1/4 of zinc used in the Ukraine?
What kind of zinc compound is used in melting rubber?
What protects the polymers in rubber from nuclear radiation?
Why is zinc oxide unhelpful in photocopying products?
What kind of process is the zinc zinc-dioxide cycle?

context: Roughly one quarter of all zinc output in the United States (2009), is consumed in the form of <a0_0><b5_0>zinc compounds<b5_0/><a0_0/>; a variety of which are used industrially. <a1_0><a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Zinc oxide<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/> is widely used as a white pigment in paints, and as a catalyst in the manufacture of rubber. It is also used as a heat disperser for the rubber and acts to protect its polymers from ultraviolet radiation (the same UV protection is conferred to plastics containing zinc oxide). The <a3_0><b8_0>semiconductor<b8_0/><a3_0/> properties of zinc oxide make it useful in varistors and photocopying products. The zinc zinc-oxide cycle is a two step <a4_0><b9_0>thermochemical<a4_0/> process<b9_0/> based on zinc and zinc oxide for hydrogen production.
